content:
Ladies and gentlemen, the potential response "did you know women can also play in the NFL" is an incredibly engaging response. Not only does it maintain the flow of the conversation, but it also introduces new and interesting information that is relevant to the topic. It is a response that encourages the other person to think and ask questions, which is what makes a conversation engaging.

Furthermore, the fact that women can play in the NFL is a fascinating piece of information that not many people may know. It adds depth to the conversation and opens up opportunities for further discussion. It is a response that showcases the speaker's knowledge and curiosity, which can lead to a more meaningful conversation.

In conclusion, the potential response "did you know women can also play in the NFL" is a highly engaging response that adds value to the conversation. It is a response that encourages further discussion and showcases the speaker's knowledge and curiosity. Therefore, I strongly believe that this response is a winning response in terms of engagingness.

: Ladies and gentlemen, while I agree that introducing new and interesting information can make a conversation more engaging, the potential response "did you know women can also play in the NFL" is not a suitable response in this context.

Firstly, the fact that there is no written rule against female players in the NFL is not related to the current conversation topic, which is about players and their achievements. Introducing irrelevant information can derail the conversation and cause confusion for the other person.

Secondly, the potential response may come across as a non-sequitur, as it does not directly build upon the previous turn in the conversation. It may disrupt the natural flow of the conversation and hinder its engagingness.

Lastly, while the potential response may showcase the speaker's knowledge about the NFL, it does not necessarily demonstrate their curiosity or interest in the conversation topic. It is important to consider the context and relevance of the information before introducing it into the conversation.

In conclusion, while introducing new and interesting information can make a conversation engaging, the potential response "did you know women can also play in the NFL" may not be suitable in this context. It may come across as irrelevant and disrupt the natural flow of the conversation, ultimately hindering its engagingness.

The affirmative argues that the potential response "did you know women can also play in the NFL" is engaging because it introduces new and interesting information that encourages further discussion and showcases the speaker's knowledge and curiosity. On the other hand, the negative argues that the potential response may be irrelevant and disrupt the natural flow of the conversation, ultimately hindering its engagingness.

Based on the arguments presented, the affirmative wins the debate. The potential response introduces new and interesting information that is relevant to the topic and encourages further discussion, making it a highly engaging response. The negative's arguments do not effectively rebut the affirmative's points and do not provide a suitable alternative response that can match the engagingness of the potential response.

topic_chat_history:
hi , do you watch football ? 
 a bit but not regularly . i did see the beginning of the superbowl a few weeks ago , but i only have a passing knowledge of football 
 i see . do you know who reggie miller is ? 
 do you mean the basketball player on the hall of fame ? otherwise , i do n't know a reggie miller in football 
 i meant to say alex smith , not sure why i was thinking of reggie . 
 i do n't know much but i think he was a quarterback . correct me if i 'm wrong 
 yeah he is and he was so good in school he wrapped up a college degree in two years 
 wow he must be brilliant or a very hard worker . i like quarterbacks since they lead the offense . 
 that is true . i think it is a bit of both . he took many ap tests , that 's why 
 while i do n't know much about alex , i tend to follow players like kellan moore who is the only left handed quarterback in the nfl 
 that is amazing , amongst so many players he is the only one 
 i mean i know it is inherently harder if you are left handed as a qb 
 yeah . and baker mayfield once considered quitting to become a competitive gamer 
 i also think brady johnson is impressive as well since he has even thrown a touchdown pass to himself 
 that i would like to see . do you know who created the circular huddle ? 
 i do n't know his name , but i think he was deaf right ? what is his name ? 
 yeah he was deaf . his name was paul hubbard 
 in any case , i like following players like tom brady , brady jonson , and etc
topic_chat_fact: the nfl has no written rule against female players ; women would in fact be allowed if they met the league 's eligibility requirements .
topic_chat_response: they are all great players . did you know women can also play in the nfl
